left-2.name: Crystalized thought echo
left-2.content:
Crystalized thought echo

-What is the dramatic question? Will the party collect the thought echo without any psychic damage, slowing their production process

-How might the world, player, understanding, NPC, change? Find something, learn about Quandrix, connection with Thessa.

-Thessa helps in some way or can give some advice because she studies quandrix

-Psyonic interactions, something for indigo to learn

-backstory of someone like a professor at the college

-many inconsequential backstories

-a hint at frunks backstory

----

Pre phase- Meet a struggling student Caelum Arcline Who is offloading a thought

Phase one- Collects and shifts the nature of one's thoughts back at them. While attached, it has a desire to collect more thoughts. Once released it stops. Multiple projects of thoughts and scenarios are shown to the party. A coalition of thoughts manifests into reality, asking to be set free. Warning of the danger. A negotiation can be used to convince it to help fight. If so, it will stifle some of the attacks to come.

Phase two- Thoughts attacking to protect the thought echo. They try to keep the party away from it. Rolls are required to pull it out.

Phase three- Psychic Reality adjustments. The thoughts of a thousand people rush over the party, stunning them and forcing them to view images of their own terrifying past or the struggles of others from within the school who have wandered by here. students sometimes use this place to "unload" unwanted memories Caelum's thought.

right-1.name: Frunk
right-1.content:
Frunk

-Beast taming points to taming points for the mirror lynx

-Wants the staff to take a chaos magic route, wants to find a way to get magic power back. He could transform and now he's just wanting to break it and go for chaos magic or darker nature ideas. find someone who works with people like him. (broken transformer people)

-Frunk's bigger goal is to become an abomination of nature. he can just get so big and be able to punch a dragon. Scale druid, manipulating the size of plants and animals -Substanceor augmentor


-Pranksters guild stuff, plan whats next


-Old Nam Frunk's old caretaker is coming to the college to take care of him. Create her character


-Dad is a diplomat.


-Backstory- repressed memory. His dad killed his wife. He and his wife were spending years in the backyard just hopping around as bunnies. His dad is a diplomat who thought that was ridiculous and, with dad energy, shot her as a bunny .  She is actually just a bunny. His mom is like the ultimate trophy wife, but literally. He caught her. She is a shape changer as well. 

-

-backup characters. Wants to play a villain. serial killer. Pick the plot now and make it feel relevant.

right-1.name: Zepha
right-1.content:
Zepha

- wants him and Nora Ann Wu to start a business combining magic and business. (like battle golems)

- Nora Ann Wu Personality is to make people wonder at her amazing sculptures. She always spins and centers cylindrical things.
Want: "shape living beauty that connects people" Wistful yearning
Fear: "quietly dismissed" nervous self-doubt

- his parents were traveling craftsmen in multiple tribes
- His tribe are nomadic, they are contracted by kingdoms to build infrastructure and stuff. They are super good at architecture. 
-lightning hammer (specifics) what exactly does it do
-Complete the projects chart for Zepha
-write ideas for forge (and the 6 parts of a forge) (heat, space, energy, knowledge, magic, materials)

right-1.content:
Sharon

-Her own newspaper. 

-How her snake behaves and some things it says

-Each article's stories in the future events

-Figure out the artifact that doesn't work and what it will do. (from her perk. It eventually needs to get activated.

-Cadoras Damellawar interactions. He wants to show something interesting around the area. He has some knowledge.

right-1.name: Indigo
right-1.content:
Indigo
-Who her mom and dad actually are needs to be decided

-Arcane dance group plans. how will this actually affect her? give her renoun?

-Create plans for the Crucible Dragon Valthrax Ironmantle Why is he here. what is his goal

right-2.name: Long term events
right-2.content:
Low-Voltage: campus-wide spell drain
1) wand lightning and continual flames start going out in the arithmodrome labs. 
2) Maintenance logs show growing demand for replacement sigil batteries in dorm waypoints. Dorm lighting goes out for a night. Quartermasters complaining 
3)Lorehold reports ancient wards and scrolls fading decades ahead of schedule (clue) access request; ink spectral analysis
4) clue: referee interview, defensive duel halted when both shields collapse simultaneously
5) clue:  hushed faculty meetings about spell rationing on campus. Minutes are sealed but a junior TA finds them on a teacher's desk
6) Clue: animal behavior, mana-eels become lethargic and undercharged despite ample feed in labs. a lab assistance shares this
7) Patterns can be mapped of locations where this is occurring. It maps to an old scryptorium ruin sealed over a decade ago (create locations that map to that location)
8) Old procurement slips for Experimental mana-reactors set up in a different location. They were canceled and scheduled to move but the location was never set up and the teacher disappeared. Original procurement slips were signed by Dean Augusta Tullus
9) The scriptorium area is sealed off and inaccessible. but there is a note about hidden in arcana message near the door asking for help from whoever the person's partner is
10) confrontation create staff member here the party can meet up with them after following the hidden message. Inteded to harvest excess campus mana bu calibration failed flipping it to uncontrolled intake. they sealed it and it sayed dormant for years but it is exponentially increasing in power absorption 
11) The item requries 2 keys to be put in correctly in an epic montage
12) campus either goes dark, shutting down all sorts of projects and stuff, or they are saviors. 

Skyfall: skyreach island project
1) Announcement and press release available early from student who over heard
2) budget committee minutes available through intern student who took notes at the meeting. Budget shows that they are massively over budget after only having just begun the project
3) Delivery logs show sub grade arcanite arriving instead of certified loadstones
4) Student worker injured from low quality materials
5) oversite budget and staffing is slashed 10% student  informant can tell Sharon
6) Whistleblower student seeks out someone to tell that the load bearing ley-web is missing redundancies
7) Mid year presentation showing a demo of the project, a small modelling crystal shutters during he Q&A
8) Campus creatures begin roosting in the half finished island and causing problems
9) An appeal to shut it down is put in by several teachers but rejected by the school board
10) Whistleblower student Levitation-core stress test postponed twice and then "passed" provisional
11) Party learns that the thing cant stay stable for more than a few hours
12) Climax: island ascends for initial flight. The crew has to get inside to bring it down or it will crash land in the campus.

Mascot Uprising: Sentience & Civil Rights
1) Quandrix's fractal mascots are upgraded with experimental matrix. patent filed in campus office
2) This particular Mascot becomes well known around campus
3) Groundskeeper reports mascot refuses storage crate, quoting philosophy texts
4) Interviews with Mascot it asks why it exists "only for school spirit"
5) Quandrix Matrix of the Weave department quietly tries to roll back cognition matrix. mascot disappears that night.
6) Cheer squad's banner spell hijacked casting "FREE THE MASCOTS" over the stadium
7)Campus security puts out a listing as the mascot being dangerous
8) Climax: decide if it should be stopped or made free. The mascot appears mid field in a game and duplicates into hundreds of fractal copies, demanding microphone time. Crowd control spells backfire into kaleidoscopic illusions and there is a serious damage done to something (permanent effect)

Blood Lines: Hemomancy Cover-up
1) Bright first year prodigy Ilyra wins potion making contest by a mile despite struggling in alchemy classes
2) Biology TA  catches Ilyra killing rabbits after hours. Professors wave off as authorized research
3) Ilyra caught collecting viles of her own blood
4) Book goes missing from

right-2.name: Dualities
right-2.content:
Lorehold

Lorehold College is devoted to the study of history, broadly understood to include the various aspects of culture, behavior, and social relationships that shape historical events. Its studies include various subdivisions of history (military history, social history, cultural history), archaeology, anthropology, psychology, sociology, religion, and economics. It overlaps with Prismari College in the field of art history, with some students splitting their studies between the two colleges. Lorehold mages use their magic to unearth secrets and share illumination.

-Order: Structure pulls people together--Law, religion, economics, education, social class... -- and each of these structures drive historical events. A focus on the systemic changes and the actions of people collectively

-Chaos: Individual actions, personal bonds of families and friends, the disruptive force of lone passionate individuals through history. Scholars of chaos gravitate toward reckless discovery and the spirit of adventure in their research of the past-- the essence and emotion of history over precision and procedure

-Scholars of Lorehold

Archaeoscribe, chronicling historical truths for posterity-Order

Battle medium, strengthening summoned spirits for use in battles -Order

Chaos scholar, chasing down historical anecdotes as a litany of happenstance -Chaos

Conservator, preserving ancient spell knowledge and other relics of the past-Order

Dustspeaker, conversing with spirits of the past to learn their stories-Chaos

Pastraiser, binding spirits into the monuments that bear their likeness to learn about their inspiring deeds -Order

Relic reader, divining wisdom from the past from the context of ruin sites -Order

Ruin shaman, wielding magic that helps delve into ancient sites -Chaos

Tomewielder, summoning fiery magic from the words in old writings -Chaos

Warsinger, studying the magic used in ancient wars -Chaos


Silverquill

The curriculum of Silverquill College revolves around words, encompassing literature (including fiction, essays, drama, and poetry), languages, linguistics, oratory, rhetoric, and dramatic performance. Students from other colleges often take Silverquill courses to improve their communication skills, learning to speak and write more effectively about their primary field of study. Silverquill and Prismari see overlap in the area of performing arts, with Silverquill emphasizing verbal performance and Prismari focusing more on dance and other forms of movement.

-Radiance: language is used as a light to illuminate others and make the world a brighter place, to uplift others, to shine a light on the evils of society and to inspire the best in those around them

-Shadow: uses language to steb, expose stinging truths and to obfuscate secrets. The magic of shadow mages manifests as bolts or blads of darkness and effects sting or shame to an assault on the targets life energy

-Scholars of Silverquill

Bantermage, using incisive observation to pierce rivals’ confidence -Shadow

Duskmage, conjuring inky voids of shadow magic -Shadow

Inkcaster, summoning living inklings to service -Shadow

Lumimancer, bringing light to bear on shameful situations and holding corrupt institutions to account -Radiance

Shadewing, forming weapons from darkness to slice and stab at foes -Shadow

Silvertongue, bathing others in the light of inspiring words-Radiance

Vainglory, wielding the power of a perfectly crafted compliment to enhance a person’s best qualities-Radiance

Warsinger, stirring hearts through poetic performance and song -Radiance


Prismari

Prismari College is dedicated to the arts. Its scholars view art as the fundamental form of self-expression and magic as a tool, a medium, and an inspiration. Prismari studies focus on visual arts (including architecture, painting, and sculpture) and performing arts (such as dance, music, and theater). The curriculum overlaps with Lorehold in the field of art history and with Silverquill in the literary arts, and some students divide their time between Prismari and one of those other schools to pursue these interdisciplinary fields. Prismari mages use magic to weave the elements into their creations; they might juxtapose fire alongside paint, ceramics, or fabric, or they might choreograph elaborate works that unite a dancer’s movements with gusts and eddies of air.

Perfection: focus on technique, analysis, theory, aesthetics, and universal principals. Focus on intellect over emotion, strives to be thought-provoking and reflective, and aspires to mastery. Mages tend to use cold, water, wind.

Expression: emphasizes portrayal of personal emotional truths. Values improvisation, innovation, and rule-breaking, and favor fire, lightning, and earth

Scholars of Prismari:

Aesthemancer, studying abstract principles of beauty for insight into the workings of the multiverse -Perfection

Electrovisionary, wielding the forms of lightning as a paintbrush-Expression

Flamesinger, combining fire and music -Expression

Geosculptor, using earth and lava in volatile emotional displays -Expression

Heartrager, turning inner creative fire into personal strength-Expression

Ice sculptor, crafting ice and cold into immersive experiences -Perfection

Mistmage, shaping cloud, fog, and mist into lasting sculptures-Perfection

Muse channeler, projecting blasts of inspiration toward others-Expression

Opusmancer, creating magical effects on a monumental scale-Perfection

Spectacle mage, hurling stormy displays into the sky-Expression

Waterbinder, shaping water into animated elemental forms -Perfection

Zephyrist, weaving wind with dance -Perfection


Witherbloom

Growth: life drives to thrive. Celebrate diversity and adaptivility of life and the most complex networks of all living things. Urge to survive and reproduce. Positive energy and healing magic.

Decay (the vein): Inevitability of death and decay. Name comes from the prominence of vampires within the college, whose conceptions of draining life through the vein have proven an important counterweight to the growth of philosophy of Witherbloom. Sees life energy as a resource to be consumed and used rather than a good to be nourished for its own sake. Negative energy and necromancy practice.

Scholars of Witherbloom:

Banelock, using concoctions of noxious ingredients for withering magic-Decay

Hemomancer, drain the essence of living creatures to fuel sinister spells-Decay

Boon witch, brewing drafts to empower the living-Growth

Boughcaller, summoning creatures from bogs-Growth

Dreadbones, infusing dead tissue with magic to create Undead servants-Decay

Earthcroucher, connecting directly with the land to power nature magic-Growth

Leafbinder, using medicinal herbs to soothe wounds-Growth

Pestcatcher, harvesting life energy from the pests of the bayou-Decay

Quandrix

Substance: emphasizes physical reality. Math is embodied in the natural forces of the multiverse waiting to be discovered by those with the intellect to delve into those secrets. Uses numerical concepts to create altered physical realities out of mathematical possibility.

Theory: focuses on abstract realms of conjecture and possibility. View math as a lens to understand the cosmos; the math itself is not something that exists (tool). Embrace this perspective to weave illusions and manipulate the fabric of magic itself.

Scholars of Quandrix:

Abstractor, using magic to stretch the possibilities of space -Theory

Augmenter, making creatures and things larger -Substance

Fractalologist, creating beautiful illusory patterns-Theory

Mana scholar, studying snarls, leylines, and star arches-Substance

Metamancer, studying metaphysics to alter reality -Theory

Scale druid, manipulating the size of plants and animals-Substance

Sequence prophet, studying repeating patterns that bend the mind-Theory

Vivifier, conjuring fractal creatures based on biological life-Substance
